Community Services & Job Support

Explore local resources

Explore local resources offering essential community services and job support to help you get ahead and make an impact.


Volunteering Australia

Volunteering Australia is the national peak body dedicated to advancing volunteering across the country. With a mission to lead, strengthen, and celebrate volunteering in Australia, the organization plays a crucial role in fostering a culture of giving and community engagement.

Whittlesea Community Connections - Women in Energy & Manufacturing

Whittlesea Community Connections supports the community by offering jobs and course Advice.

üìû 03 9401 6666

üì± Facebook Page

 

AGA

AGA provide flexible and tailored employment and training services for apprentices and trainees that empower individuals and help build businesses.

AGA also provide Transition to Work (TtW) services that are Funded by the federal government. TtW helps young adults (aged 15 to 24) develop practical skills to help them get a job, as well as ongoing career development support.

 

üåêWebsite

üìû 1300 000 242

üì± Facebook Page

 

Melbourne Polytechnic Skills and Jobs Centre (Epping)

Melbourne Polytechnic Epping facilities offer students a practical learning experience. You‚Äôll apply the skills you learn from day one, in our industrial training facilities for agriculture, viticulture and winemaking and trades.

Prace has 30 years‚Äô experience providing innovative and high quality Adult Community Education (ACE) programs.

RMIT Skills and Jobs Centre

RMIT Skills and Jobs Centre provides the local community and prospective students with free, independent advice on entering the workforce, re-skilling and more.

üåê Website

üìû 0418 465 633

üì± Facebook Page

 

Youth Projects

Youth Projects provides comprehensive support to early school leavers and young people, offering intensive pre-employment assistance to help them build the skills and confidence needed to transition into sustainable and meaningful employment or education. They also offer a Disability Employment Services program tailored specifically to young people, helping them achieve their employment and education goals. Additionally, their Healthcare Career Jumpstart program supports young individuals facing challenges, guiding them towards meaningful employment in the healthcare sector.

üåê Website

üìû 03 9304 9100

üì± Facebook Page

 

atWork Australia

atWork Australia works with people living with disability, injury, health condition, or those who require additional support, to find meaningful and sustainable employment. 

üåê Website

üìû 1300 080 856

üì± Facebook Page

 

Sarina Russo

Sarina Russo offers employment services support for people in the community where English is a second language, and individuals with disabilities.

SYC

SYC provides services that foster wellbeing, independence and opportunity for all Australians.
